Judge Mark G. Mastroianni: ELECTRONIC ORDER entered. Plaintiff's request to seal is temporarily allowed pending review by the magistrate judge, who will handle all non-dispositive pretrial motions as per ORDER to follow. Accordingly, the Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to seal Plaintiff's ( 1 ) Complaint and Defendant's memoranda ( 8 & 11 ), including attachments thereto, in support of Defendant's ( 7 ) Motion to Strike and ( 10 ) Motion to Seal. This temporary seal shall only remain until the magistrate judge rules on each motion. This temporary measure in no way reflects the Court's view on the merits of either motion. (Bartlett, Timothy) Modified on 1/5/2018 to correct reference to Dkt. No. 8 from text reading "9" (Bartlett, Timothy). (Entered: 01/05/2018)

Judge Mark G. Mastroianni: ELECTRONIC ORDER entered REFERRING CASE to Magistrate Judge Katherine A. Robertson. Referred for: Full Pretrial, No Dispositive Motions (ptn). Motions referred: 10 MOTION to Seal Document 1 Complaint, 7 MOTION to Strike 1 Complaint. (Bartlett, Timothy) Motions referred to Katherine A. Robertson. (Entered: 01/05/2018)

Magistrate Judge Katherine A. Robertson: ELECTRONIC ORDER entered granting 22 on a temporary basis the putative intervenor's Emergency Motion to Seal. The Clerk's Office is directed to amend docket entries 15, 16, 17, and 18 to remove the name of the putative intervenor, and to impound the accompanying documents pending the court's ruling on docket entries 7, 10, and 17/18. This temporary seal shall only remain in effect until the court rules on each motion and in no way reflects a ruling on the merits of the underlying dispute. (Robertson, Katherine) (Entered: 01/26/2018)
